title: bitnomad.store
author: bitnomad.store
created_time: February 14, 2023, 01:14:16 AMLast edit: February 14, 2023, 03:14:34 AM by bitnomad.store
content: Hello everyone, BTCbitnomad (https://bitnomad.store) is an online store that specializes in providing high-tech products to its customers, all of which can be purchased using Bitcoin.We believe that Bitcoin has the potential to disrupt the traditional financial system, and we are at the forefront of this change. Our platform is designed to make it easy and convenient for people to buy electronics with Bitcoin, and we believe that this will help to drive the adoption of cryptocurrency as a means of payment.The product range at Bitnomad is vast, and we offer a wide variety of products that include laptops, smartphones, gaming headsets, 4K projectors, and much more. Our products are sourced from leading brands and manufacturers, ensuring that our customers receive only the best quality products.One of the key features is our commitment to security. We understand that the safety of our customers' personal and financial information is of the utmost importance, and we have taken the necessary measures to ensure that our platform is secure. All transactions are processed through secure encrypted channels (actually Coinbase), and we use state-of-the-art security protocols to protect our customers' information.With its comprehensive product range, ease of use, and commitment to security, we believe that bitnomad is set to become the go-to platform for people who want to buy electronics with Bitcoin.WE DO SHIP WORLDWIDEFeel free to contact us at info@bitnomad.store or Nostr : npub1asdm7rt4fvxm5rcpttmaxsu5795y6wt9zmeyyx58khrresmvywlshnc2q7

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: I like it. Where do you source your products from? Do you get them from third parties like Amazon for example?P.S. If you are interested in more sales then you should also list Apple products, because those things tend to sell out fast due to high demand.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on February 14, 2023, 10:22:02 AMI like it. Where do you source your products from? Do you get them from third parties like Amazon for example?P.S. If you are interested in more sales then you should also list Apple products, because those things tend to sell out fast due to high demand.Hey there   Thank you for your feedback!We source our products directly from manufacturers and suppliers, which allows us to offer high-quality products at competitive prices.We continuously evaluate the market demand and customer feedback to expand our product portfolio and include popular products like Apple. (Probably in the next month)We appreciate your suggestion and will consider it for future product offerings. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. <3If you have any more suggested products, please let us know about it.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: bitnomad.store on February 14, 2023, 01:14:16 AMWE DO SHIP WORLDWIDEQuote from: https://bitnomad.store/faq/We do ship worldwide. But in case your country is not reached by our courier, we will inform you right away to make necessary changes to your order or refund your order in full. We do not ship to Russia and Ukraine currently.Can you explain the highlighted part in more detail? Does it mean you're willing to use an additional courier service [from a different country] to deliver products?- Am I correct in assuming that you only have one warehouse?

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on February 14, 2023, 07:05:43 PMQuote from: bitnomad.store on February 14, 2023, 01:14:16 AMWE DO SHIP WORLDWIDEQuote from: https://bitnomad.store/faq/We do ship worldwide. But in case your country is not reached by our courier, we will inform you right away to make necessary changes to your order or refund your order in full. We do not ship to Russia and Ukraine currently.Can you explain the highlighted part in more detail? Does it mean you're willing to use an additional courier service [from a different country] to deliver products?- Am I correct in assuming that you only have one warehouse?Surething SFR10, We currently have several suppliers and manufacturers that have warehouses in Spain / Russia (Autel products and Mini PC's) / United States / United Kingdom / France and Germany.We can't assume that 100% of our product is shipped worldwide (but some of them   ) because Ukraine and Russia is currently having some issues receiving packets outside Asia   We ship without problem to more than 100 countries.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: bitnomad.store on February 14, 2023, 08:05:06 PMSurething SFR10, We currently have several suppliers and manufacturers that have warehouses in Spain / Russia (Autel products and Mini PC's) / United States / United Kingdom / France and Germany.I was under the impression that you'd be ordering directly from the manufacturers and having them send the products to your warehouse in the US [because of the content in your "terms & conditions" page] and then you'd be shipping them to customers, but looks like I was wrong [my bad (as long as there's a European country in the equation, it should be fine)].I just noticed "some" of the products mention from where they're being shipped while there are also products that let us choose from where they'll be shipped to us [e.g. this one (great feature)].

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on February 15, 2023, 11:30:56 AMIt's bold move to only accept cryptocurrency. Anyway,1. Does your courier offer service to handle all custom/import duys fee on behalf of us (the buyer/receiver of the goods)?2. Your search function seems to be broken. I tried few keyword (such as "Intel") but always got message "No products were found matching your selection.". For reference, i tried it on Firefox browser.Hey Buddy!1 - Of course! We are happy to offer a customs handling service for our customers. That's why we're seeking with our suppliers having warehouses around the globe. Eliminating the customs fee the most2 - Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced while using our search function. Our team have fixed it right now. If you need help finding nor suggesting a specific product, please feel free to contact us. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on February 15, 2023, 08:06:49 AMQuote from: bitnomad.store on February 14, 2023, 08:05:06 PMSurething SFR10, We currently have several suppliers and manufacturers that have warehouses in Spain / Russia (Autel products and Mini PC's) / United States / United Kingdom / France and Germany.I was under the impression that you'd be ordering directly from the manufacturers and having them send the products to your warehouse in the US [because of the content in your "terms & conditions" page] and then you'd be shipping them to customers, but looks like I was wrong [my bad (as long as there's a European country in the equation, it should be fine)].I just noticed "some" of the products mention from where they're being shipped while there are also products that let us choose from where they'll be shipped to us [e.g. this one (great feature)].Ohh! I got your point of view!Our shipping method is more efficient than that way. We instantly contact the supplier after the purchase, and then we manage it to be sent from the nearest warehouse available.To be honest, this 5v solar panel is badass. you can feel the quality by touch.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: *Bump*   We've just added a cryptocurrency ticker to our website, so you can now shop with confidence and stay up-to-date on the latest prices.With this new feature, you can easily keep track of the current cryptocurrency prices and make informed purchase decisions.Whether you're a seasoned crypto trader or just getting started, our new ticker is designed to make your shopping experience smoother and more convenient than ever before.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: WE ARE NOW SHIPPING TO RUSSIA AND UKRAINE

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: I couldn't find any smartphones on your site but you said in your announcement they should be part of the offer. I guess you removed them for some reason.Are the prices on your site up-to-date? I am asking because when I tried to check what phones you have, I saw this in the results: LENOVO Laptop ThinkPad X1 Gen 5This is a €4-5k laptop if the info I found is correct, but you have it on offer for $12,000.What is the situation with the smartphones?

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on March 05, 2023, 08:59:18 AMI couldn't find any smartphones on your site but you said in your announcement they should be part of the offer. I guess you removed them for some reason.Are the prices on your site up-to-date? I am asking because when I tried to check what phones you have, I saw this in the results: LENOVO Laptop ThinkPad X1 Gen 5This is a €4-5k laptop if the info I found is correct, but you have it on offer for $12,000.What is the situation with the smartphones?Hello there Pmalek!Unfortunately we has to remove all our smartphones listing due to suppliers stocks. (It will be back in several days)The Lenovo Laptop price has been manually raised to $12k by the supplier due unconfirmed volume on warehouses. "We are now removing this listing because it may seems too confuse. Sorry about that"We are also working on several platform upgrades that suppliers can leave a properly information to our customers.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: bitnomad.store on March 06, 2023, 04:54:14 PMThe Lenovo Laptop price has been manually raised to $12k by the supplier due unconfirmed volume on warehouses. That's a weird supplier you have there. I won't go as far as to call them untrustworthy or malicious, but I am thinking about it. Supplier goes: We aren't sure if we still have this laptop in our warehouse, but you can always pay us $12,000 instead of $6.000. We would really appreciate it.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on March 06, 2023, 05:33:04 PMQuote from: bitnomad.store on March 06, 2023, 04:54:14 PMThe Lenovo Laptop price has been manually raised to $12k by the supplier due unconfirmed volume on warehouses. That's a weird supplier you have there. I won't go as far as to call them untrustworthy or malicious, but I am thinking about it. Supplier goes: We aren't sure if we still have this laptop in our warehouse, but you can always pay us $12,000 instead of $6.000. We would really appreciate it.  Ah!  To be honest the error is ours, they raised the price to avoid people buy it. If he disable the listing by himself he couldn't re-open it.It wont happen again.

comments.author: bitnomad.store
comments.body: Hello Plebs!  We have partnered with Binance Pay, and now you can checkout pay easily using your Binance account scanning the QR Code thru your smartphone.

comments.author: DainSLane
comments.created_time: March 25, 2023, 05:33:10 PMLast edit: March 29, 2023, 07:26:18 AM by DainSLane
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on March 05, 2023, 08:59:18 AMI couldn't find any smartphones on your site but you said in your announcement they should be part of the offer. I guess you removed them for some reason.Are the prices on your site up-to-date? I am asking because when I tried to check what phones you have, I saw this in the results: LENOVO Laptop ThinkPad X1 Gen 5This is a €4-5k laptop if the info I found is correct, but you have it on offer for $12,000.What is the situation with the smartphones?I thing the prices you mentioned its important to always verify the accuracy of prices before making a purchase. Prices can vary depending on various factors such as location availabatity, and market demand. It possible that the prices you saw were incorrect. I recommend checking with the website or company directly to ensure that you have the most upto date information.
